title: Book of the Stranger
transcript:
DOLOROUS EDD: Where you gonna go?
JON SNOW: South
DOLOROUS EDD: What are you gonna do?
JON SNOW: Get warm
DOLOROUS EDD: I was with you at Hardhome We saw what's out there We know it's coming here How can you leave us now?
JON SNOW: I did everything I could You know that
DOLOROUS EDD: You swore a vow
JON SNOW: Aye, I pledged my life to the Night's Watch I gave my life"
DOLOROUS EDD: For all nights to come
JON SNOW: They killed me, Edd! My own brothers You want me to stay here after that?"
MAN: Riders approaching!
MAN: Open the gate!
SANSA STARK: This is good soup Do you remember those kidney pies Old Nan used to make?
JON SNOW: With the peas and onions?
SANSA STARK: Mmm
JON SNOW: We never should have left Winterfell
SANSA STARK: Don't you wish we could go back to the day we left? I want to scream at myself, “Don't go, you idiot”"
JON SNOW: How could we know?
SANSA STARK: I spent a lot of time thinking about what as ass I was to you I wish I could change everything
JON SNOW: We were children
SANSA STARK: I was awful, just admit it"
JON SNOW: You were occasionally awful I'm sure I can't have been great fun Always sulking in the corner while the rest of you played
SANSA STARK: Can you forgive me?
JON SNOW: There's nothing to forgive
SANSA STARK: Forgive me
JON SNOW: All right All right, I forgive you"
JON SNOW: You'd think after thousands of years, the Night's Watch would have learned how to make a good ale"
SANSA STARK: Where will you go?
JON SNOW: Where will we go? If I don't watch over you, Father's ghost will come back and murder me"
SANSA STARK: Where will we go?
JON SNOW: I can't stay here, not after what happened"
SANSA STARK: There's only one place we can go Home
JON SNOW: Should we tell the Boltons to pack up and leave?
SANSA STARK: We'll take it back from them
JON SNOW: I don't have an army
SANSA STARK: How many wildlings did you save?
JON SNOW: They didn't come here to serve me
SANSA STARK: They owe you their lives
SANSA STARK: You think they'll be safe here if Roose Bolton remains Warden of the North?
JON SNOW: Sansa
SANSA STARK: Winterfell is our home It's ours and Arya's and Bran's and Rickon's Wherever they are, it belongs to our family We have to fight for it"
JON SNOW: I'm tired of fighting
JON SNOW: It's all I've done since I left home I've killed brothers of the Night's Watch I've killed wildlings I've killed men that I admire I hanged a boy younger than Bran I fought and I lost
SANSA STARK: If we don't take back the North, we'll never be safe I want you to help me But I'll do it myself if I have to"
DAVOS: My lady
MELISANDRE: Ser Davos
DAVOS: Will you stay here at Castle Black?
MELISANDRE: I will do as Jon Snow commands
DAVOS: You serve Jon Snow now?
MELISANDRE: He's the prince that was promised
DAVOS: Forgive me, my lady, I thought that was Stannis"
DAVOS: What happened down there?
MELISANDRE: There was a battle Stannis was defeated
DAVOS: And Shireen? What happened to the princess?
BRIENNE: I saw what happened I saw Stannis' forces defeated in the field
DAVOS: My lady, I'm Ser Davos Seaworth"
BRIENNE: We've met before I was Kingsguard to Renly Baratheon Before Renly was assassinated with bloodmagic
DAVOS: That's in the past now
BRIENNE: Yes, it's in the past It doesn't mean I forget Or forgive He admitted it, you know"
DAVOS: Who did?
BRIENNE: Stannis Just before I executed him
PETYR BAELISH: The Defender of the Vale!
ROBIN: Uncle Petyr!
PETYR BAELISH: My lord Come and see
PETYR BAELISH: I missed your name day Go on
ROBIN: A falcon!
PETYR BAELISH: A gyrfalcon The greatest and rarest of birds
YOHN ROYCE: Last time I saw you, Baelish, you told me you were taking Sansa Stark home with you to the Fingers."
PETYR BAELISH: Indeed I was
YOHN ROYCE: And yet not long ago, we received reports that she has been married to Ramsay Bolton in Winterfell"
PETYR BAELISH: On our way to the Fingers, we were set upon by a large force of Bolton men Seemed to know exactly when we were traveling and exactly whom we were transporting"
YOHN ROYCE: Do you take me for a fool?
PETYR BAELISH: Tell me, Lord Royce, how many people knew of my travel plans with Sansa Stark? I shared my intentions with you and no one else"
YOHN ROYCE: Slander a man in his own home, you might find yourself crossing swords with him"
PETYR BAELISH: Your home is the Vale The Lord of the Vale stands before us And only his judgment concerns me
ROBIN: Shall we throw him through the Moon Door?
YOHN ROYCE: My lord My lord, I have always been faithful to House Arryn To your father, to your mother, and now to you."
ROBIN: Do you believe him, Uncle Petyr?"
PETYR BAELISH: Lord Royce has served the Vale well He;s enjoyed a distinguished military career If we could trust his absolute loyalty, he would make a capable commander in the wars to come"
YOHN ROYCE: You can trust my absolute loyalty, my lord"
PETYR BAELISH: I think he deserves one more chance What do you say?
ROBIN: Fine
PETYR BAELISH: I bring good news My friends in the North tell me Sansa has escaped Winterfell I expect she's headed to Castle Black where her brother serves as Lord Commander But she won't be safe there, not with the Boltons after her"
ROBIN: She's my cousin We should help her
PETYR BAELISH: That was my instinct as well
PETYR BAELISH: Our lord has spoken Gather the Knights of the Vale The time has come to join the fray
GREY WORM: You invite the enemy into our city?
TYRION LANNISTER: I did As a clever man once told me, “We make peace with our enemies, not our friends”"
GREY WORM: I don't make peace with the queen's enemies I kill the queen's enemies
TYRION LANNISTER: Yes, that's the military approach And how has that worked here in Meereen? I represent the diplomatic approach"
MISSANDEI: Our queen tried to make peace with the Masters and they tried to murder her
TYRION LANNISTER: We enter these negotiations with open eyes Trust me My own recent experience with slavery has taught me the horrors of that institution
MISSANDEI: How many days were you a slave?
TYRION LANNISTER: Long enough to know
MISSANDEI: Not long enough to understand
YEZZAN: I bought this dwarf for a single gold honor And somehow you've risen to the top of the Great Pyramid of Meereen It's most impressive
TYRION LANNISTER: And now you speak for the Good Masters of AstaporHere's to reversals of fortune
RAZDAL: We came here to meet the queen and instead we're greeted by a dwarf and a eunuch
TYRION LANNISTER: Let's make this simple, shall we? Tell me what you want"
BELICHO: We want you to leave Slaver's Bay Take your dragons and your mercenaries and go
TYRION LANNISTER: Queen Daenerys won't stay in Meereen forever Her path takes her westward
RAZDAL: When we last met, I offered her ships so she could return to Westeros where she belongs She refused them"
MISSANDEI: She refused them because hundreds of thousands of men, women, and children still lived in chains"
RAZDAL: As they have since the dawn of time
GREY WORM: Not anymore
YEZZAN: You think you're a free man now? You still follow orders Just because your master has silver hair and tits doesn't mean she's not a master
TYRION LANNISTER: Friends, friends, friends, please"
TYRION LANNISTER: There have always been those with wealth and power and those with nothing That is the way of the world I'm not here to change the way of the world
YEZZAN: Slavery is the way of our world
TYRION LANNISTER: You don't need slaves to make money There haven't been slaves in Westeros for hundreds of years and I grew up richer than any of you But our queen recognizes that she erred by abolishing slavery without providing a new system to replace it So here is the queen's proposal Slavery will never return to Meereen but she will give the other cities of Slaver's Bay time to adjust to the new order
YEZZAN: What does that mean?
TYRION LANNISTER: Instead of abolishing slavery overnight, we will give you seven years to end the practice"
TYRION LANNISTER: Slaveholders will be compensated for their losses, of course, at fair prices In exchange, you will cut off your support for the Sons of the Harpy"
YEZZAN: We do not support the Sons of the Harpy
TYRION LANNISTER: Fine, fine, but you will cut it off all the same I do hope you accept, my friends You will not receive a better offer"
TYRION LANNISTER: Let us sail on the tide of freedom instead of being drowned by it And as a parting gift to our honored guests…
TYRION LANNISTER: Give freedom a chance See if it doesn't taste every bit as good as what came before
TYRION LANNISTER: My friends! Large sorry...you wait so fat time
MISSANDEI: Perhaps I should translate for you
MAN: We speak the Common Tongue
TYRION LANNISTER: Excellent
MAN: You met with the slavers today
TYRION LANNISTER: I did
MAN: Our brothers and sister died fighting these scum Now you invite them to our city and drink wine with them
TYRION LANNISTER: I imagine this room was built so the rulers could intimidate the ruled
TYRION LANNISTER: But I am not your ruler I'm not the Breaker of Chains I'm not the Unburnt And I am certainly not the Mother of Dragons
MAN: You are a stranger here So why do you represent Meereen in these talks with our enemies?
TYRION LANNISTER: Because our queen chose me as her advisor Until she returns from her travels --
MAN: When does she return?
TYRION LANNISTER: Soon You have my word
MAN: We don't know you We don't trust you We know Torgo Nudho We fight with him against the Masters We trust him
TYRION LANNISTER: And that is exactly why Grey Worm took part in these negotiations As commander of the Unsullied, he knows hot to defeat the slavers and he knows when it is time to make peace"
MAN: You have made peace with the slavers?
TYRION LANNISTER: We offered terms
MAN: And you, Grey Worm? You want to drink wine with these men? The men who tore us from our mothers' arms and sold us at auction like cattle?"
GREY WORM: I am a soldier, not a politician But if there is a chance for peace -- a just peace -- we should take it"
MAN: Missandei, you know what these men are How can you trust them?"
MISSANDEI: I do not trust them I will never trust them
MISSANDEI: But as a wise man once said, “We make peace with our enemies, not our friends”"
GREY WORM: Do not use me for your lies
TYRION LANNISTER: Those men respect you
GREY WORM: They respect me because they know who I am They know I am loyal
TYRION LANNISTER: As do I
GREY WORM: I am loyal to my queen, not you If you betray her work, you are my enemy"
TYRION LANNISTER: I am not betraying her work I am trying to save her city
MISSANDEI: You promised the slavers they could keep slavery
TYRION LANNISTER: For a short time
MISSANDEI: Seven years is not a short time for a slave
TYRION LANNISTER: You're right Slavery is a horror that should be ended at once War is a horror that should be ended at once I can't do both today
GREY WORM: You are wrong to trust these men
TYRION LANNISTER: I don't trust the Masters I trust their self-interest They're trustworthy if they're convinced that working with me is in their self-interest
GREY WORM: You don't know them You don't understand them We are not human in their eyes They look at me and see a weapon They look at her and see a whore
TYRION LANNISTER: They look at me and they see a misshapen little beast Their contempt is their weakness They'll underestimate us every time and we will use that to our advantage
GREY WORM: You will not use them They will use you That is what they do
DAARIO: You all right? Why don't you sit and catch your breath?
JORAH MORMONT: I'm fine
DAARIO: I don't think you could ride the dragon 20 years ago, maybe"
JORAH MORMONT: What?
DAARIO: Our queen She's wild, you know Don't let her size fool you It's hard enough for me and I'm a young man You, I don't think your heart could take it"
DAARIO: Must make you angry that our queen chose me
JORAH MORMONT: Makes me sad You'll disappoint her before long She'll move on
DAARIO: We'll all disappoint her before long
JORAH MORMONT: We need each other right now After we're done needing each other --
DAARIO: Oh, I don't want to fight you, Jorah the Andal What do I have to gain? If I win, I'm the shit who killed an old man If I lose, I'm the shit who was killed by an old man"
JORAH MORMONT: You didn't get much discipline as a child, did you?"
DAARIO: None
JORAH MORMONT: The road running through the Horse Gate, they call that the godsway"
JORAH MORMONT: Eastern Market, Western Market When Khal Drogo died, she was supposed to come here and join the Dosh Khaleen, the widows of the dead khals That's where they would have taken her, the Temple of the Dosh Khaleen"
DAARIO: What are you doing?
JORAH MORMONT: It's forbidden to carry weapons in the sacred city
DAARIO: Isn't it forbidden to sneak into their city and steal their khaleesi?
JORAH MORMONT: If they spot us and we're unarmed, we'll say we're traders heading for the Western Market But if they see weapons…"
DAARIO: You're asking a dog to hand over his teeth
JORAH MORMONT: There's 100,000 of them down there We can't fight our way out We wait till dark, and then we'll find her"
DAARIO: Uh…
DAARIO: I'm very attached to this knife
JORAH MORMONT: Don't worry it didn't touch you
DAARIO: You know what happens?
JORAH MORMONT: I know what happens
DAARIO: I'll do it myself.
DAARIO: I should have been born a Dothraki
JORAH MORMONT: Come on
JORAH MORMONT: My friends...We wandered off from the Western Market and got lost Could you show us the way back?
DOTHRAKI: What do you sell?
JORAH MORMONT: Wine Come down to my stall tomorrow, I'll give you a cask of the Arbor's finest"
DOTHRAKI: You're not merchants
DOTHRAKI: Get the others
DAARIO: Told you, I'm very attached to this knife"
DAARIO: You all right?
JORAH MORMONT: If they find a body with a stab wound, the whole city will be looking for us"
DAARIO: Huh
LEADER: Some of them don't think Dothraki should breed with foreigners They are stupid old women They don't realize that we have always diluted our blood This one is Lhazareen Her Khal found her hiding in a well after he burned her village How old were you?
LHAZAREEN WOMAN: Twelve
LEADER: A year later, she bore her Khal a daughter How did he show his happiness?"
LHAZAREEN WOMAN: He broke my ribs
LEADER: We are not queens here, but the khals depend on us for our wisdom Our lives have meaning"
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: That is more than most have
LEADER: When the khals meet for the Khalar Vezhven tomorrow night, I hope they let you live out your days with us The other possibilities are not so pleasant"
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I need to make water
LEADER: You can't run from Dothraki You know this
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I will never run from Dothraki
LEADER: Go, show her"
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I needed fresh air The old women stink
LHAZAREEN WOMAN: They do stink
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: You must have been very young when your Khal died
LHAZAREEN WOMAN: Sixteen
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Too bad he didn't die sooner
LHAZAREEN WOMAN: Yes, too bad"
LHAZAREEN WOMAN: Is it true you have three dragons?
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Mm-hmm
LHAZAREEN WOMAN: And they breathe fire?
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: They do Would you like to see them one day?
LHAZAREEN WOMAN: I am Dosh Khaleen I can never leave Vaes Dothrak, until I rise as smoke from the pyre on the day I die"
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: No, don't hurt her"
DAARIO: She'll give us away
JORAH MORMONT: We have to go now
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: We will never get out of Vaes Dothrak alive
JORAH MORMONT: All we can do is try
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: No We can do more than that And you're going to help me
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: And you...Have faith in me, Khaleesi Do not betray me"
SPARROW: If I were to let you leave right now, where would you go? What would you seek out?"
MARGAERY TYRELL: I'd go to my brother, my husband, my family"
SPARROW: Of course, but for you, that means seeking out money, finery, power Seeking out your family means seeking out sin I'm not maligning you I sought those things out, too. To the exclusion of all else My father was a cobbler He died with I was young and I took over his shop He was a simple man and he made simple shoes But I found that the more work I put into my shoes, the more people wanted them Fine leather, ornamentation, detailing, and time Time most of all Dozens of hours spent on a single pair"
MARGAERY TYRELL: Quality takes time
SPARROW: Yes I imagine you've worn a year of someone's life on your back The highborn liked to cover their feet with my time and they paid well for the privilege I used their money to buy a taste of their lives for myself Each time I indulged, I felt myself ascending to something better"
MARGAERY TYRELL: And one day you walked through a graveyard and realized it was all for nothing and set out on the path to righteousness Book of the Stranger, verse 25"
SPARROW: You know
MARGAERY TYRELL: Septa Unella reads it to me At me
SPARROW: Yes, yes, she does enjoy reading at people You're close But it wasn't a graveyard It was a feast I bought old fine wine and young pretty girls and invited my friends to come share it all We passed around the wine, passed around the women, and soon we fell into a stupor I woke before dawn I could barely stand Everyone else was asleep on the couches or on the floor, lying in heaps next to their fine clothes The truth of their bodies laid bare I could smell them beneath the incense and the perfume and the fine food that had already started to turn And I saw it with perfect clarity I saw what my sins were The gold I had, the wine I drank, the women I used, my ceaseless struggle to maintain my position It was all part of a story A story I was telling myself about who I was A collection of lies that would disappear in the light The people I was trying to climb away from, the beggars in the street, the poor, they were closer to the truth than I ever was"
MARGAERY TYRELL: So what did you do?
SPARROW: I left to go and find them I didn't even put on my shoes I walked out the door and never went back
SPARROW: Come, let's go and see him"
MARGAERY TYRELL: Who?
SPARROW: Your brother
MARGAERY TYRELL: enters her brother's cell. The door closes and locks behind her. Loras is lying on the floor.
MARGAERY TYRELL: Loras. Loras.
MARGAERY TYRELL: helps LORAS to his knees. He cries.
MARGAERY TYRELL: Listen to me. You need to stay strong.
LORAS: I can't stay strong. I never was strong.
MARGAERY TYRELL: You are strong. You are the future of our house, the future of our family."
LORAS: I don't care about that.
MARGAERY TYRELL: Shh. Have you -- have you told them that? That you don't care?
LORAS: I just want it to stop. Help me.
MARGAERY TYRELL: They want me to help you. They want me told help tear you down. That's why he's letting me see you, I know it is. And if either of us give in to what they want, then they win."
LORAS: Let them win. Just make it stop. Please.
LORAS: begins sobbing. MARGAERY embraces him.
MARGAERY TYRELL: All right.
CERSEI LANNISTER: is walking down the hall to TOMMEN's chamber. She hears MAESTER PYCELLE talking.
MAESTER PYCELLE: And now, how to avert disaster with our current predicament. This High Sparrow. I have dealt with fanatics of every description, Your Grace. Not setting them off, that's the most important thing. You are beset with enemies both within and without."
CERSEI LANNISTER: enters the room
CERSEI LANNISTER: What are you doing here?
MAESTER PYCELLE: I am advising the king on our current predicament.
CERSEI LANNISTER: Leave.
MAESTER PYCELL: I am a member of the Small Council. The king's small --
CERSEI LANNISTER: Is this a Small Council meeting?
MAESTER PYCELL: Obviously not. I'm here to lend my wisdom and my support.
TOMMEN LANNISTER: Thank you for your counsel, Grand Maester. That will be all for now."
MAESTER PYCELL: Your Grace.
MAESTER: PYCELLE hobbles towards the door. As he leaves, he flashes CERSEI a smile. CERSEI closes the door."
CERSEI LANNISTER: Since I've missed the past several Small Coucil meetings, I wanted to speak to you about a few things."
TOMMEN LANNISTER: I've been thinking about the High Sparrow.
CERSEI LANNISTER: As have we all, unfortunately."
TOMMEN LANNISTER: We need to be careful in dealing with such a man. To prevent things from escalating any further. We have to be careful not to antagonize him. He has Margaery. We can't put her at risk. He's dangerous.
CERSEI LANNISTER: Look at me. What did they do to me? To the king's own mother?
CERSEI LANNISTER: It's all right. It's done. It's in the past. And of course Margaery's safety is paramount.
TOMMEN LANNISTER: You don't like Margaery, do you?"
CERSEI LANNISTER: Whether I like her or not is completely unimportant. Margaery is the queen. Queens must command respect. Kings even more so. Not just for their own sake, but for everyone's. The High Sparrow has no respect for kings or queens. No respect for anything in this world. He has no use for the things of this world. He want to knock them down and replace them with what? With fantasies. With beggars in the street. With nothing."
TOMMEN LANNISTER: Mother...there's something I want to tell you. Something the High Sparrow told me.
CERSEI LANNISTER: You've spoken with him?
TOMMEN LANNISTER: I promised him I wouldn't tell anyone. If he found out I told --
CERSEI LANNISTER: It would be a breach of confidence which he would not take lightly, given his constant prattling about the truth. I am your mother. You can always trust me."
KEVAN: and LADY OLENNA are waiting in the Small Council chamber for the meeting to start. CERSEI and JAIME enter.
CERSEI LANNISTER: The Small Council meeting has been postponed on the king's orders.
KEVIN: and LADY OLENNA stand up.
LADY OLENNA: I would have thought we were perfectly clear the first time. You're not welcome.
CERSEI LANNISTER: You once spoke of your respect for our father because he understood the necessity of working with one's rivals.
LADY OLENNA: My dear, you have been stripped of your dignity and authority, publicly shamed, and confined to the Red Keep. What's left to work with?"
JAIME LANNISTER: Cersei is the mother of the king. She has the king's ear and his trust. And the king has been speaking regularly with the High Sparrow about Queen Margaery and Ser Loras.
CERSEI LANNISTER: The High Sparrow seized power knowing full well we'd bicker amongst ourselves instead of seizing it back. Here we are. Well done to us. Now the future of the Seven Kingdoms rest in his dirty, peasant hands. In a few days, he'll have a trial for me. But before that, Queen Margaery will make her walk of atonement. Yes, Margaery will repent her sins before the good people of the city."
LADY OLENNA: Oh, no. That cannot happen. That will not happen."
CERSEI LANNISTER: I agree.
JAIME LANNISTER: You've got the second largest army in Westeros. You'll bring them into the city, stop queen Margaery's humiliation before it starts, and take her back into Crown custody."
KEVAN: The king has ordered me to take no action against the High Sparrow or the Faith Militant out of fear for the queen's safety.
JAIME LANNISTER: You'll take no action at all. When the Tyrell armies come, you will stand down. Are you expressly forbidden from standing down?"
KEVAN: No, but if the king should call on me --"
JAIME LANNISTER: The whole thing will be over before anyone can call on you to do anything. When the High Sparrow is in custody or dead, preferably, and Margaery's back at Tommen's side, do you think the king will be angry at the outcome?"
CERSEI LANNISTER: You hate these fanatics as much as we do. You hate what they've done to your son. Do you want Lancel back or have you given him up for good?
KEVAN: Of course I want him back.
CERSEI LANNISTER: Then stand aside and let the people that took him from you be destroyed.
KEVAN: If it doesn't go as planned, the Sparrows have many friends in the city. We'll have civil war. Many will die."
LADY OLENNA: Many will die no matter what we do. Better them than us.
THEON GREYJOY: approaches Pyke Castle by boat.
YARA GREYJOY: They told me you were home and I didn't believe it. “Theon Greyjoy?” I said. “He's dead. He's been dead a long time."" He let you go?"
THEON GREYJOY: I escaped.
YARA GREYJOY: I can't hear you.
YARA GREYJOY: Look at me. Look at me! Men died trying to rescue you. Good men. My men.
THEON GREYJOY: I'm sorry.
YARA GREYJOY: You were my brother. You're a spoiled little cunt, but you were my brother and I risked everything for you and you betrayed me."
THEON GREYJOY: I know. I know and I'm sorry.
YARA GREYJOY: Stop saying that.
THEON GREYJOY: He broke me. He broke me into a thousand pieces.
YARA GREYJOY: I know.
THEON GREYJOY: You don't know.
YARA GREYJOY: He send us one of those pieces. That's why I came for you.
YARA GREYJOY: Why did you come here?
THEON GREYJOY: Where else could I go?
YARA GREYJOY: You heard father was dead and thought you'd claim the crown?
THEON GREYJOY: No, no. I only heard he died after we docked."
YARA GREYJOY: You happen to show up on Pyke right before the Kingsmoot?
THEON GREYJOY: I didn't know.
YARA GREYJOY: You think any Ironborn wants you to be king? After what you've done?
THEON GREYJOY: I don't want to be king.
YARA GREYJOY: What do you want?
THEON GREYJOY: I shouldo ve listened to you. You're the only one --
YARA GREYJOY: That doesn't matter anymore. Stop crying. Look at me. Tell me what you want.
THEON GREYJOY: You should rule the Iron Islands. Let me help you.
RAMSAY BOLTON: peels an apple with a knife. The door opens. A guard ushers OSHA into the room. RAMSAY nods. The guard leaves and closes the door.
RAMSAY BOLTON: They've cleaned you up nicely. You know who I am?
OSHA: A lord?
RAMSAY BOLTON: Yes. A lord. You've seen my banners?
OSHA: The flayed man.
RAMSAY BOLTON: Does that worry you at all?
OSHA: You eat them after?
RAMSAY BOLTON: No.
OSHA: Then I've seen worse.
RAMSAY BOLTON: peels the skin of the apple and puts it on the table with the knife. OSHA looks at the knife. RAMSAY waves for OSHA to come to him. She walks towards him.
RAMSAY BOLTON: You served the Starks?
OSHA: Aye. They put me in chains and put a sword at my throat, so I've served them."
RAMSAY BOLTON: The Starks have been gone for a long time, but you kept protecting Rickon."
OSHA: He'd fetch a good price to the right buyer. I served his family a long time. Didn't get no wages. Way I see it, I'm owed."
RAMSAY BOLTON: Be that as it may, Rickon's not yours to sell anymore. He's mine. So what use could I possibly have for you?"
OSHA: I can give you what you want.
RAMSAY BOLTON: Are you sure you know what that is?
OSHA: comes closer and sits down on his lap. They kiss.
OSHA: Same thing men always want. And when they really want it, they give it a bath first."
RAMSAY BOLTON: You're a good talker.
RAMSAY BOLTON: I like that.
RAMSAY BOLTON: You're a much better talker than Theon Greyjoy.
OSHA: That so?
RAMSAY BOLTON: I had to work hard to get him talking. But he talked. They all do.
